reasoning: Rare primary CNS tumor. PXA accounts for <0.3% of primary CNS tumors with annual incidence <0.7 per 100,000. Temporal lobe is the most common location (37% of PXA cases per SEER data), yielding estimated incidence of 0.26 per 100,000 for temporal lobe specific subtype.
source: SEER (Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program) registry data; NCI Central Brain Tumor Registry
